snippet: President Obama’s top military adviser said he would consider deploying a limited number of American forces to fight alongside Iraqi troops moving to retake areas held by militants.
abstract: Gen Martin E Dempsey, chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff, tells House committee he would consider deploying limited number of American forces to accompany Iraqi troops on complex offensive operations to retake Mosul and other areas under control of Islamic State militants.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER, DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Washington, David D. Kirkpatrick from Baghdad, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s top military adviser said he would consider deploying a limited number of American forces to fight alongside Iraqi troops moving to retake areas held by militants.

headline.main: Top U.S. General Says He’s Open to Using Ground Troops to Retake Mosul
headline.print_headline: Top U.S. General Says He’s Open to Using Ground Troops to Retake Mosul

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
